trans-unit.source: You can return an encrypted database to an unencrypted state by specifying attributes on the connection URL.

seg-source.mrk: You can return an encrypted database to an unencrypted state by specifying attributes on the connection URL.

target.mrk: You can return an encrypted database to an unencrypted state by specifying attributes on the connection URL.

trans-unit.source: To decrypt an encrypted database, specify the decryptDatabase=true attribute in conjunction with either the bootPassword=key attribute or the encryptionKey=key attribute.

seg-source.mrk: To decrypt an encrypted database, specify the decryptDatabase=true attribute in conjunction with either the bootPassword=key attribute or the encryptionKey=key attribute.

target.mrk: To decrypt an encrypted database, specify the decryptDatabase=true attribute in conjunction with either the bootPassword=key attribute or the encryptionKey=key attribute.

trans-unit.source: See the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph> for details on the connection URL attributes.

seg-source.mrk: See the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph> for details on the connection URL attributes.

target.mrk: See the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph> for details on the connection URL attributes.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that you have enough free disk space before you decrypt a database. In addition to the disk space required for the unencrypted size of the database, temporary disk space is required to store the encrypted version of the data to restore the database to its encrypted state if the decryption is interrupted or returns errors. All of the temporary disk space is released back to the operating system after the database is decrypted.

seg-source.mrk: Ensure that you have enough free disk space before you decrypt a database.

In addition to the disk space required for the unencrypted size of the database, temporary disk space is required to store the encrypted version of the data to restore the database to its encrypted state if the decryption is interrupted or returns errors.
All of the temporary disk space is released back to the operating system after the database is decrypted.

target.mrk: Ensure that you have enough free disk space before you decrypt a database.

In addition to the disk space required for the unencrypted size of the database, temporary disk space is required to store the encrypted version of the data to restore the database to its encrypted state if the decryption is interrupted or returns errors.
All of the temporary disk space is released back to the operating system after the database is decrypted.

trans-unit.source: You must shut down the database before you decrypt it. An attempt to decrypt a booted database has no effect.

seg-source.mrk: You must shut down the database before you decrypt it.
An attempt to decrypt a booted database has no effect.

target.mrk: You must shut down the database before you decrypt it.
An attempt to decrypt a booted database has no effect.

trans-unit.source: If the database is configured with log archival, you must disable log archival in addition to shutting down the database before you can decrypt the database. You should also create a new backup of the database before you decrypt it, and create another after you decrypt it. For more information, see the section "Backing up and restoring databases" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph>, particularly "Roll-forward recovery".

seg-source.mrk: If the database is configured with log archival, you must disable log archival in addition to shutting down the database before you can decrypt the database.
You should also create a new backup of the database before you decrypt it, and create another after you decrypt it.
For more information, see the section "Backing up and restoring databases" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph>, particularly "Roll-forward recovery".

target.mrk: If the database is configured with log archival, you must disable log archival in addition to shutting down the database before you can decrypt the database.
You should also create a new backup of the database before you decrypt it, and create another after you decrypt it.
For more information, see the section "Backing up and restoring databases" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph>, particularly "Roll-forward recovery".

trans-unit.source: If any global transactions are in the prepared state after recovery, the database cannot be decrypted.

seg-source.mrk: If any global transactions are in the prepared state after recovery, the database cannot be decrypted.

target.mrk: If any global transactions are in the prepared state after recovery, the database cannot be decrypted.

trans-unit.source: If <xref href="cdevcsecure36127.dita#cdevcsecure36127">authentication</xref> and <xref href="cdevcsecure36595.dita#cdevcsecure36595">SQL authorization</xref> are both enabled, the credentials of the <xref href="cdevcsecureDbOwner.dita#cdevcsecureDbOwner">database owner</xref> must be supplied as well, since decryption is a restricted operation.

seg-source.mrk: If <xref href="cdevcsecure36127.dita#cdevcsecure36127">authentication</xref> and <xref href="cdevcsecure36595.dita#cdevcsecure36595">SQL authorization</xref> are both enabled, the credentials of the <xref href="cdevcsecureDbOwner.dita#cdevcsecureDbOwner">database owner</xref> must be supplied as well, since decryption is a restricted operation.

target.mrk: If <xref href="cdevcsecure36127.dita#cdevcsecure36127">authentication</xref> and <xref href="cdevcsecure36595.dita#cdevcsecure36595">SQL authorization</xref> are both enabled, the credentials of the <xref href="cdevcsecureDbOwner.dita#cdevcsecureDbOwner">database owner</xref> must be supplied as well, since decryption is a restricted operation.

trans-unit.source: After you decrypt the database, be sure to check for SQLWarnings. The decryption succeeded only if there were no SQLWarnings or SQLExceptions.

seg-source.mrk: After you decrypt the database, be sure to check for SQLWarnings.
The decryption succeeded only if there were no SQLWarnings or SQLExceptions.

target.mrk: After you decrypt the database, be sure to check for SQLWarnings.
The decryption succeeded only if there were no SQLWarnings or SQLExceptions.
